Problem 3.2

Fighting Fleas: Representing Exponential Decay

Exponential patterns like the one in Problem 3.1, in which a quantity decreases at each stage by a constant factor, show exponential decay. The factor is called the decay factor. A decay factor is always greater than 0 and less than 1. In Problem 3.1, the decay factor is Â½. Exponential decay patterns are also exponential functions. Their growth pattern is decreasing rather than increasing.

In this problem we will look at another exponential decay problem.
